definitions.definition: To die from suffocation while immersed in water or other fluid .
examples: When I was a baby, I nearly drowned in the bathtub.

definitions.definition: To kill by suffocating in water or another liquid.
examples: The car thief fought with an officer and tried to drown a police dog before being shot while escaping.

definitions.definition: To be flooded : to be inundated with or submerged in (literally) water or (figuratively) other things ; to be overwhelmed .
examples: We are drowning in information but starving for wisdom.
He drowns his sorrows in buckets of chocolate ice cream.

definitions.definition: To obscure , particularly amid an overwhelming volume of other items .
examples: The answers intelligence services seek are often drowned in the flood of information they can now gather.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To die from suffocation while immersed in water or other fluid .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To kill by suffocating in water or another liquid.
( intransitive ) To be flooded : to be inundated with or submerged in (literally) water or (figuratively) other things ; to be overwhelmed .
( transitive , figurative ) To inundate, submerge, overwhelm .
( transitive , figurative , usually passive voice ) To obscure , particularly amid an overwhelming volume of other items .
